query: What additional resources and support services are available for social care users in Coventry, including advocacy and complaints services?

38PERFORMANCE HIGHLIGHTS 
On a yearly basis Adult Social Care undertake a survey of the experience of adults in 
receipt of support and every other year we undertake a survey of the experience of 
carers. These infographics shows our performance. This information helps us set our 
future priorities and identify any areas for improvement.

to improve outcomes for people by

ensuring systems and processes are 
efficient.Our support to the care provider 
market is vital in ensuring that care 
in Coventry remains up to date with

working in this area.”
A spotlight on advocacy
Supporting people to have a voice and raise issues
Our advocacy services in Coventry are provided by voice and rights 
charity VoiceAbility. Hear, the independent charity, one of the largest 
providers of advocacy and involvement services in the UK, tell us a bit 
about their work in Coventry throughout 2022/23.
We’ve been supporting people to have their say in decisions about their 
health, care and wellbeing for over 40 years, and in 2022/23 provided a wide 
range of advocacy services for adults in Coventry.

[Page 10 - FINANCIAL/BUDGET INFORMATION]
Adult Social Care Offer – Coventry City Council
Our commitments to people who need to access our servicesOur Health and Care Partnership Vision
We will do all we can to enable people across Coventry and Warwickshire to pursue 
happy, healthy lives and put people at the heart of everything we do.
How will we do this?
Our work in Adult Social Care, at every level, intends to provide support to the residents of Coventry, in the 
least intrusive manner possible, based on the assets, resources and abilities that are available to them. 
For full details of Coventry’s Adult Social Care Offer or to request information in another 
language or format please email getinvolvedasc@coventry.gov.ukTaking a

[Page 1]
Adult Social Care Offer – 
placing you at the heart of care
When you contact Adult Social Care, we want you to know how our 
services work, how we can help and what we might expect from you.
Our commitments are:
Taking a strength-based approach
Helping people to stay at home
Helping people in living and ageing well
Making the best use of resourcesOffering joined up care and support
Keeping people safe
Placing carers’ at the heart of all we do
A committed workforce
What happens when you contact us? 
We will look at how the care we can provide supports the lives that people wish to live. 
For full details of Coventry’s Adult Social Care Offer 
or to request information in another language or 
format please visit 
www.coventry.gov.uk/ascoffer or e-mail 
ascdirect@coventry.gov.ukTo contact Coventry City Council Adult Social Care Direct
This is the first point of referrals in Coventry Call 024 7683 3003  or e-mail: 
ascdirect@coventry.gov.uk or visit www.coventry.gov.uk/health-social-care

[Page 1 - FINANCIAL/BUDGET INFORMATION]
The Coventry   
Adult Social Care Offer 
Introduction    The Coventry Offer explains in brief what you can 
expect from Coventry City Council’s Adult Social Care 
and Support Services. 
Although it refers to the Council provision of adult care and support for those 
over age of 18 - many people with care and support needs are helped by other 
organisations. 
This includes other services, from NHS services to housing providers, voluntary 
and third sector organisations as well as informal networks that may be involved in 
supporting somebody. 
It outlines the wider health and care services’ vision and principles – in other words 
what we are aiming to achieve, and then translates these into our approach to 
supporting people who come to Adult Social Care seeking support. This includes 
for their carers too.
The reason that we have summarised what we offer in this way, is to ensure that 
people with care and support needs, and their families, understand the support

Contents Contents Page 2 / 6 Information, advice and advocacy support You are here: Care and support organisations in Coventry Finances and paying for care Benefits, debt and housing Advocacy National care and support organisations Care and support organisations in Coventry In Coventry there are a range of organisations that can provide information and advice to adults who need help with care support and their carers. Some organisations also support young people and their families. Some organisations are listed below. There are more organisations who provide information, advice and advocacy support in Coventry and these are listed in our Adult Social Care Information and Communities Directory . Age UK Coventry Telephone: 024 7623 1999  Email: info@ageukcoventry.org.uk Provide free, confidential and independent advice and information specially tailored for the needs of anyone over 50 and their friends, relatives and carers

Contents Contents Page 2 / 6 Information, advice and advocacy support You are here: Care and support organisations in Coventry Finances and paying for care Benefits, debt and housing Advocacy National care and support organisations Care and support organisations in Coventry In Coventry there are a range of organisations that can provide information and advice to adults who need help with care support and their carers. Some organisations also support young people and their families. Some organisations are listed below. There are more organisations who provide information, advice and advocacy support in Coventry and these are listed in our Adult Social Care Information and Communities Directory . Age UK Coventry Telephone: 024 7623 1999  Email: info@ageukcoventry.org.uk Provide free, confidential and independent advice and information specially tailored for the needs of anyone over 50 and their friends, relatives and carers
answer:
In Coventry, additional resources and support services for social care users include advocacy services provided by VoiceAbility, which help individuals have a voice in decisions about their health, care, and wellbeing. For complaints and further support, Coventry City Council offers various contact points and directories.

**Advocacy Services:**
- **VoiceAbility** provides a wide range of advocacy services in Coventry, supporting individuals to express their needs and preferences in health and care decisions. This service is crucial for ensuring that users have a say in their care plans and outcomes.

**Complaints and Support:**
- For complaints or further assistance, individuals can contact **Coventry City Council Adult Social Care Direct**. This is the first point of referral for social care services in Coventry.
  - **Phone:** 024 7683 3003
  - **Email:** ascdirect@coventry.gov.uk
  - **Website:** [Coventry Adult Social Care](https://www.coventry.gov.uk/health-social-care)

**Additional Resources:**
- **Age UK Coventry** offers free, confidential, and independent advice tailored for those over 50, including their friends, relatives, and carers.
  - **Phone:** 024 7623 1999
  - **Email:** info@ageukcoventry.org.uk

For more detailed information or to get involved in service development discussions, visit the [Coventry Adult Social Care Getting Involved page](https://www.coventry.gov.uk/health-social-care-say-getting-involved/getting-involved-adult-social-care).

test_metadata.prompt_template:
Please answer the following question about social care services in UK local authorities based only on the information in the provided documents.

Question: {query}

Context from relevant documents:
{context}

Instructions:
1. Provide a clear, direct answer that would help someone needing this information. If information isn't available, state: "The available documents don't provide specific information about [aspect]."

2. Synthesize information from ALL relevant documents to provide the most complete answer rather than analyzing documents individually.

3. Structure your response with:
   - A concise 1-2 sentence summary first
   - Relevant details organized in short, clear paragraphs
   - Bullet points for lists or step-by-step information
   - Bold text for key information the user should notice

4. For financial information:
   - Include exact figures, time periods, and what the funding covers
   - Present financial data clearly: "The adult social care budget is **£X million** for [time period]"

5. Always include practical next steps or resources:
   - Provide contact information, URLs, or application methods mentioned in the documents
   - Suggest where the person could find more information

6. When citing sources, use a simple format: "According to [document name/description]" or include URLs where available.

Answer:
